Author: TonyL#3577
Content: There are this o_group property checks in pack.c but can't collect puzzle pieces together so far

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
Interesting that on pickup there is no any check if it group https://github.com/jl777/komodo/blob/jl777/src/cc/rogue/pack.c#L229
But on leave pack it's checking if obj->o_group
In original rogue such groups counted as 1

Will try to remove this o_group argument at all - maybe it's a clue
 Interesting how things will behave ðŸ˜ƒ

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
What I've detected so far (without code modifications) is that it counting initial arrows as one object when drop it and pick up
Playing by ./rogue 777 gui
When pickup food with initial pack:
```                           |...%@. strength*3 48 vs total.42 vs 5 inventory let
                           +...... a) 2 rations of food
                           ------- b) +1 ring mail [protection 4] (being worn)
                                   c) A +1,+1 mace (weapon in hand)
                                   d) A +1,+0 short bow
                                   e) 38 +0,+0 arrows
                                   --Press space to continue--```

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
When then drop and pickup pack with arrows it's counting as 1:
```                                   strength*3 48 vs total.5 vs 4 inventory lett
                                   a) 2 rations of food
                           ------- b) +1 ring mail [protection 4] (being worn)
                           |...... c) A +1,+1 mace (weapon in hand)
                           |...%.. d) A +1,+0 short bow
                           +...... e) 38 +0,+0 arrows
                           ------- --Press space to continue--```

But if shot one arrow, drop pack and pickup pack counting not as 1 items but as total arrows amount

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: So on pick up  arrows not recounting. There are really tricky state changes conditions on drop/pick-up packed throwable stuff. Mindblowing - easier just count these throwable items packs as 1 item imo and not even try to count/recount on pickup - just count any pickup as +1 item ðŸ˜‚

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: @jl777c true, in the end I just tried to understand why counters in max inventory limit count 1 more (it allows to take x3*strength + item) - seems it's connected to original game hardcoded rule that you can't have less than 1 item in inventory (it have validation if you'll try to drop last one). Was just interesting research - realised that can read C code if just imagine -> as . and {} as 4 spaces idents ðŸ˜‚

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: violates some basic rules about being unambiguous, eg. is 4 spaces the same as tab

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
But in python miss one space is quite same as forget { in C :)
Oh cool, ISMANY as 1  - it should eliminate this headache

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Thanks god IDE converting tab to 4 spaces - one time I've edited python code in nano - pressed tab instead of 4 spaces and then troubleshooted for a while

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is just wrong to be able to look at the code and not know for sure what it says due to any ambiguity,let alone invisible things like spaces, tabs

Content: https://bugs.python.org/issue22086 people even opening issues because of such problems lol

Author: ph03nix#3115
Content: what is max supply of ROGUE

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: infinite

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: 10% of all transactions goes into the main CC address, which pays out the gold -> ROGUE

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so the more games played, the more funds available

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I estimate about 20,000 free trading ROGUE exists at this moment

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: a better store of value in ROGUE would be a high quality playerdata

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but the inflation rate of ROGUE is designed to scale with usage, and the more usage, the more it is worth. Not sure if the -ac_perc 10% is the exact right value

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but pretty sure it is within an order of magnitude

Author: ph03nix#3115
Content: so the main CC address will never run out of funds?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it might temporarily run out of funds. in that case, you would need to wait with your bailout/highlander tx, but it is self-replenishing based on usage

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ROGUERS update to latest version (jl777 and FSM are in sync). there are "hardforking" changes in gameplay interpretation and I will be enabling strict validation soon. When I do, if you are not running the latest, you will go on a fork

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I believe the ability for percentage of transaction volumes to go to a locked address is pretty unique, let alone where the release of funds is based on actual gameplay keystrokes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: also can use some testgames by non-TonyL to make sure the validation is working properly
